attributes.action: Create an annual budget for road resurfacing
attributes.additional_details: There are a huge amount of roads in the UK which are full of potholes and damaged. This needs to be taken care of as it is can and does cause drivers to lose control of their vehicle and crash. If there was an annual budget for resurfacing roads, it could help save lives.
attributes.background: The Government should give local councils a sum of money each year dedicated to resurfacing the nation’s roads.

rejection.details:
The Government already provides funding to local authorities for the purpose of road maintenance: https://www.gov.uk/government/publications/roads-funding-information-pack/roads-funding-information-pack

We have published the following petitions, calling on the Government to impose new obligations on local authorities in respect of road maintenance, which you might like to sign:

Force councils to repair potholes faster & get claims for damages paid quicker: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/301304

Make it law that all local councils should have annual road checks in their area: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/300356

You could start a petition calling on the Government to increase local authority funding for road maintenance, but this should be clear what changes you want the Government to make to current funding allocations.
